definition: to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots

sentences.english: We must embalm the master's wise opinions.
sentences.chinese: 这位大师的崇论闳议，我们一定要铭记于心。

sentences.english: All the programme is perfectly worked out and learnt by heart.
sentences.chinese: 所有的节目都被演员完美的表演并铭记在心。

sentences.english: What doesn't get written down, will not be remembered.
sentences.chinese: 没有被写下来的东西，是不能被铭记于心的。

sentences.english: Nothing will be able to erase our wonderful memories, we will remember them forever.
sentences.chinese: 没什么能抹掉我们美好的记忆，我们会永远铭记在心。

sentences.english: My little sister, you should firmly engrave, by the side of heart.
sentences.chinese: 妹妹，你要牢牢铭记，在心灵的边陲。

sentences.english: Realise this deeply, carry it in your heart when you walk the world.
sentences.chinese: 要透彻地领悟到这一点，在你窗荡世界时铭记于心。

sentences.english: Chanel's dedication to the apparel industry will never be forgotten by people of the world .
sentences.chinese: 世界人民将永远铭记夏奈尔对服装业的贡献。

sentences.english: But he will not be remembered as a martyr.
sentences.chinese: 但是他并没有像一名殉道者一样被人们铭记。

sentences.english: Japan should remember and reflect upon history.
sentences.chinese: 日本应铭记历史，深刻反思。

sentences.english: Seek the fellowship of godly men, harken unto their words and remember them.
sentences.chinese: 与虔诚之人结交，倾听其话语并铭记在心。

sentences.english: He says people of his generation do remember.
sentences.chinese: 他说他那一代人却是铭记于心。

sentences.english: Their moving story will be forever branded on the brains of us, our children and grandchildren.
sentences.chinese: 他们的感人事迹将永远被我们以及子孙铭记。

sentences.english: It is a picture that those who were able to attend the Games will carry with them forever.
sentences.chinese: 这一画面将被亲历过北京奥运会的人们所永远铭记。

sentences.english: Then disengage from the Gregorian mind trap and re-connect with the synchronic order.
sentences.chinese: 然后脱离阳历铭记陷阱和重新连接同步秩序。

sentences.english: We should treasure up such a lesson in our memory.
sentences.chinese: 我们应将这样一个教训铭记在心。

sentences.english: It was his son, Chiang Ching-kuo, who will be remembered for ushering in political reform.
sentences.chinese: 因引入政治改革而被人铭记的是蒋介石的儿子蒋经国。

definition: Never forget national humiliation, refers to Mukden railway incident of 18th September 1931 九一八事變|九一八事变 and subsequent Japanese annexation of Manchuria
to commemorate/to recall fondly/to think of the past

national humiliation, refers to Japanese incursions into China in the 1930s and 40s, and more especially to Mukden railway incident of 18th September 1931 九一八事變|九一八事变 and subsequent Japanese annexation of Manchuria
to remember/to bear in mind/to learn by heart
lit. carved in bones and engraved in the heart (idiom)/fig. etched in one's memory/unforgettable
to be forgotten/to fade from memory
